title: [$250] iOS app crashes with EXC_BREAKPOINT in YAPLPermissionManager.hasContactPermissions

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1772026836510929) ### Background: Following the[ Sentry error](https://expensify.sentry.io/issues/7099206984/?environment=staging&environment=production&project=4510228107427840&query=is%3Aunresolved%20level%3A%EF%80%8DContains%EF%80%8Dfatal&referrer=issue-stream&sort=freq), a fatal EXC_BREAKPOINT crash occurring in the OD native Swift code on iOS. ### Problem The iOS HybridApp crashes with a fatal EXC_BREAKPOINT when the user interacts with contact-related features in the OD . The crash occurs in YAPLPermissionManager.hasContactPermissions [https://github.com/Expensify/Mobile-Expensify/blob/0dbc7e13299f65eaf911b6df5ea864f[…]/iOS/Expensify/Libraries/YAPL-Cocoa/YaplPermissionManager.swift](https://github.com/Expensify/Mobile-Expensify/blob/0dbc7e13299f65eaf911b6df5ea864f02fb4eb1f/iOS/Expensify/Libraries/YAPL-Cocoa/YaplPermissionManager.swift#L38) ### Root Cause Apple introduced a new CNAuthorizationStatus.limited case (rawValue 4) in iOS 18 as part of the "Limited Access to Contacts" feature ([Apple Documentation](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Contacts/CNAuthorizationStatus/limited)). This allows users to grant an app access to only a subset of their contacts rather than all-or-nothing. The current switch statement in hasContactPermissions only handles .denied, .restricted, .authorized, and .notDetermined. When a user grants limited contact access on iOS 18+, the new .limited status falls into the @unknown default branch, which calls fatalError(), crashing the app immediately. ### Solution Handle .limited as an explicit case alongside .authorized ``` case .authorized, .limited: // ✅ Treat limited as authorized callback(true) ```

Created a new expense for an Expensify subscription billed at $45.00 USD. 2. Credit card was charged C$62.85. 3. Manually entered C$62.85 as the expense amount (to match the actual credit card charge). 4. Attached the receipt showing the $45.00 USD billing amount. 5. Saved the expense to a report. 6. Exported the report to a spreadsheet. ## Expected Result: The exported report should display C$62.85, exactly matching the manually entered amount and the credit card charge. No additional currency conversion or tax recalculation should occur during export. ## Actual Result: The exported report displays the amount as C$85.63 instead of C$62.85. The system appears to convert the manually entered amount, resulting in an inflated exported value. A warning message also appears stating “Amount greater than scanned receipt,” suggesting the system is misinterpreting the entered currency and applying unintended conversion logic. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos The screenshot for the issue is in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771979206082789) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Rename `Move expense` to `Move to report`

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug

body:
**Original issue:** https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/604155 ## Problem The bulk action button labeled `Move expense` in NewDot is unclear; users don't realize it's how to add selected expenses to a report. **User session showing confusion:** https://fsty.io/v/BjSvdFes ## Expected Behavior Rename the action to `Move to report` while keeping the existing menu behavior: - Select an existing report - Create a new report - Remove expenses from a report (move to unreported) ## Solution — Label Change Only Update the `moveExpenses` translation key in `src/languages/en.ts` and `src/languages/es.ts` (and corresponding docs) to say "Move to report" instead of "Move expense(s)". No functional changes needed. ### Files to Change **Code (translation strings):** 1. `src/languages/en.ts:1494` — Change `moveExpenses: () => ({one: 'Move expense', other: 'Move expenses'})` → `moveExpenses: () => ({one: 'Move to report', other: 'Move to report'})` 2. `src/languages/es.ts:1328` — Change `moveExpenses: () => ({one: 'Mover gasto', other: 'Mover gastos'})` → Update with appropriate Spanish translation (e.g., `Mover a informe`) **Docs (references to "Move expense(s)" as a button label):** 3. `docs/articles/new-expensify/reports-and-expenses/Managing-Expenses-in-a-Report.md` — Update references like "**Move expense(s)**" to "**Move to report**" 4. Other docs files referencing the button label: `Getting-Started-with-the-Reports-Page.md`, `Delete-Expenses.md`, `Edit-Expense-Reports.md`, `Understanding-Report-Statuses-and-Actions.md` **No changes needed in these files** (they reference the translation key, which remains `iou.moveExpenses`): - `src/hooks/useSelectedTransactionsActions.ts:351` - `src/pages/Search/SearchPage.tsx:1011` - `src/pages/iou/request/step/IOURequestEditReportCommon.tsx:311` ### Open Questions - Should `moveUnreportedExpense` (line 1382: "Move unreported expense") also be renamed for consistency? - Should `moveToPersonalSpace` (line 1210: "Move expenses to your personal space") be updated similarly? - Confirm the Spanish translation — "Mover a informe" is the direct translation; the team may prefer different phrasing.
